pullRequest.body:
It seems that a lot of `erw` hell around concrete categories comes from defeq abuse in morphisms causing friction with the non-category theoretic part of the library.

This is a proof of concept for `AlgebraCat` as this is one of the less developed concrete, algebraic categories.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [c769a6a507](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19065/commits/c769a6a50787de714b4088cd254478808b1b10de)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Hom`
`+ comp_apply`
`+ forget_map`
`+ forget_obj`
`+ hom_comp`
`+ hom_ext`
`+ hom_id`
`+ hom_ofHom`
`+ instance {M N : AlgebraCat.{v} R} : CoeFun (M ⟶ N) (fun _ ↦ M → N)`
`+ ofHom_comp`
`+ ofHom_hom`
`+ ofHom_id`
`- AlgHom.comp_id_algebraCat`
`- AlgHom.id_algebraCat_comp`
`- coe_comp`
`- instance {M N : AlgebraCat.{v} R} : AlgHomClass (M ⟶ N) R M N`
`- instance {M N : AlgebraCat.{v} R} : FunLike (M ⟶ N) M N`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.63, 0.01)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5094|-2|porting notes|
|219|-1|disabled simpNF lints|
|1547|-6|erw|

Current commit [c769a6a507](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/c769a6a50787de714b4088cd254478808b1b10de)
Reference commit [54d12203eb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/54d12203eb2afd003111899bd0a35c3ee74bb6af)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/3592a324-de1b-439e-81e0-6f7ffafff991/to/052ccd3c-1fa0-40fb-bd4c-138777a1fc41) against commit 54d12203eb2afd003111899bd0a35c3ee74bb6af:
```diff
  Benchmark                                    Metric         Change
  ==================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.AlgebraCat.Basic   instructions    35.6%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+13.885⬝10⁹|(+0.00%)|
|`Mathlib.Algebra.Category.AlgebraCat.Basic`|+10.633⬝10⁹|(+35.56%)|
|`Mathlib.Algebra.Category.AlgebraCat.Limits`|+8.195⬝10⁹|(+14.51%)|
|`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Internal.Module`|-5.748⬝10⁹|(-3.69%)|
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/e48df370-99ac-428b-a2bf-c5f03ae6ea12) for commit 2be08069902d0154c669be6395ba28d7251b47e3.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/3592a324-de1b-439e-81e0-6f7ffafff991/to/e48df370-99ac-428b-a2bf-c5f03ae6ea12) against commit 54d12203eb2afd003111899bd0a35c3ee74bb6af:
```diff
  Benchmark                                     Metric         Change
  ===================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.AlgebraCat.Basic    instructions    35.6%
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.AlgebraCat.Limits   instructions    32.1%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+24.109⬝10⁹|(+0.01%)|
|`Mathlib.Algebra.Category.AlgebraCat.Limits`|+18.99⬝10⁹|(+32.05%)|
|`Mathlib.Algebra.Category.AlgebraCat.Basic`|+10.634⬝10⁹|(+35.57%)|
|`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Internal.Module`|-5.730⬝10⁹|(-3.68%)|

I am now happy with this benchmark. The +1.2% in `lint` is gone. The increase in instructions in the `Basic` file is mostly because it became longer, the increase in the `Limits` file is because synthesizing `MulHomClass` and friends from an `AlgHom` is slow independently of this change. A possible fix is to restore `AlgHom.map_{mul,add,one,zero}`. One of the above benchmarks confirms that this significantly decreases build time again.

Things would probably improve if you used 
```lean
comp := fun ⟨f⟩ ⟨g⟩ => ⟨g.comp f⟩
```
and below as necessary.
In general, if you are willing to use the anonymous constructor notation is some spots, you can more cleanly preserve API boundaries and still get the automation you want.
Changed, I _think_ I found all of them, but if not, please say so.
Locally, it does not seem to make a difference, but I only know how to measure build time, not instruction count.

I don't necessarily think it will help with performance much. The main thing is that Lean can choke on eta reduction when it is deep enough in a term so it is less problematic theoretically to avoid the extra eta expansions. But perhaps. 

I think the main performance penalty is a lot of failed simp unification attempts.

The main slowdown seems to come from synthesizing `MulHomClass` etc. around L103 of `AlgebraCat.Limits`. Using the deprecated `AlgHom.map_mul` and friends as a shortcut gets build time roughly back to the `FunLike` version.
Why was the suggestion reverted?
Because it caused a slowdown of another +4⬝10⁹ instructions and because I wanted to get numbers for the `map_mul` -> `AlgHom.map_mul` change independently of your suggestion.
Happy to revert the revert if you think it is better, but it seems strange to me that performance got worse.

I think it is more a symptom of problems with the current design - like the too generic lemmas - than anything else. Writing out eta expanded terms when unnecessary is inadvisable. I would prefer it be avoided here.
Okay, re-applied the commit.

You might be able to use
```suggestion
structure AlgebraCat where of ::
```
here, and then drop `of` below. Fine to leave to a follow-up PR though.
Ah, this doesn't work because unfortunately `R` is implicit. Maybe @kmill knows if there's any syntax for overriding argument implicitness in constructors, or if any is planned.
Is `of ::` any different (ignoring the wrong variable implicitness) from the independent `AlgCat.of` other than saving some lines?
It saves having two identical functions (your current version means `mk ::`), which can be annoying if the wrong one ends up in your goal state.
Ah, I forgot about the `.mk` constructor.

Similarly,
```suggestion
structure Hom (A B : AlgebraCat.{v} R) where ofHom ::
```
might let you drop `ofHom` below.
This does seem to produce `Hom.ofHom` which is undesirable. Tricking it with `_root_.AlgebraCat.ofHom ::` also does not work.

The `export` command allows you to remove the `Hom` namespace, something like:
```lean
namespace AlgebraCat

export Hom (hom)

end AlgebraCat
```

(untested)

`toHom` or `toAlgHom` might be a better name, which matches `QuadraticModuleCat.toIsometry`; though we can of course rename that one instead.

Perhaps a zulip poll for how to name these is sensible?
Started [a zulip poll](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Fixing.20the.20.60erw.60.20hell.20around.20concrete.20categories/near/483148460)
The poll has a slight favor for `.hom` so I went with that.
This should be in the test library with `import Mathlib` to guard against problems downstream of the module. If you wanted to keep it fast, you could also limit heartbeats there.

pullRequest.title: refactor(Algebra/Category): turn homs in `AlgebraCat` into a structure

|`build`|+24.109⬝10⁹|(+0.01%)|

I am now happy with this benchmark. The +1.2% in `lint` is gone. The increase in instructions in the `Basic` file is mostly because it became longer, the increase in the `Limits` file is because synthesizing `MulHomClass` and friends from an `AlgHom` is slow independently of this change. A possible fix is to restore `AlgHom.map_{mul,add,one,zero}`. One of the above benchmarks confirms that this significantly decreases build time again.
